instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2530 Greenlight no fan spin
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Any history available?
Please post more information.

Do you get L7770 voltage?

Did you press power button?
This board doesn't start by itself; is an old C2D, not iCore.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

threads.title: 820-2530 Greenlight no fan spin
threads.message:
Thank you and hello.

I don't have any history of the board i found a few of these a1278 model boards only and am trying to go through them and see if i can fix it(fan spin).
(I am trying to learn)

I have not tried the power button I did not know it was necessary to turn on thank you for that explanation.

L7770 gives me 1.06v on both sides

I do not know how to Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L. Does this mean press the power button then test?

Thanks again

threads.title: 820-2530 Greenlight no fan spin
threads.message: The fan spin turns on when I press the wire to ground and goes above 1 amp for that moment. Is it normal for it to turn off after? Also I do not know how to check for drop pulse. The schematic shows the PM_PWRBTN_L is inside U1400 and U4900.

threads.title: 820-2530 Greenlight no fan spin
threads.message:
"Is it normal for it to turn off after?"
I hope you didn't maintain the short over R5015/16 pads.
Make just temporary contact, like pressing power button.
Yeah, PM_PWRBTN_L is not available on this platform; check reaction at PM_SLP_S4_L instead.

threads.title: 820-2530 Greenlight no fan spin
threads.message:
Nope I just made temporary click but i thought it would stay on. PM_SLP_S4_L has 3.3V when making contact.
Thanks

threads.title: 820-2530 Greenlight no fan spin
threads.message:
Once remove the short, PM_SLP_S4_L stays high?
Also check PM_SLP_S3_L.
If yes, you should get voltage on big coils.
